content: Jeremiah Saved from Death(A)
In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the , saying,

“Thus says the : ‘Stand in the court of the ’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah, which come to worship  the ’s house, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Do not diminish a word.
Perhaps everyone will listen and turn from his evil way, that I may relent concerning the calamity which I purpose to bring on them because of the evil of their doings.’
And you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the : “If you will not listen to Me, to walk in My law which I have set before you,
to heed the words of My servants the prophets whom I sent to you, both rising up early and sending  (but you have not heeded),
then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.” ’ ”
So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the .

Now it happened, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the  had commanded  to speak to all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You will surely die!

Why have you prophesied in the name of the , saying, ‘This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate, without an inhabitant’?” And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the .
When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the house of the  and sat down in the entry of the New Gate of the ’s
And the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and all the people, saying, “This man deserves to die! For he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”
Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and all the people, saying: “The  sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city with all the words that you have heard.
Now therefore, amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the  your God; then the  will relent concerning the doom that He has pronounced against you.
As for me, here I am, in your hand; do with me as seems good and proper to you.

But know for certain that if you put me to death, you will surely bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants; for truly the  has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.”
So the princes and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, “This man does not deserve to die. For he has spoken to us in the name of the  our God.”
Then certain of the elders of the land rose up and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying:
“Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘Thus says the  of hosts:

Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah ever put him to death? Did he not fear the  and seek the ’s favor? And the  relented concerning the doom which He had pronounced against them. But we are doing great evil against ourselves.”

Now there was also a man who prophesied in the name of the , Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjath Jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah.
And when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Urijah heard  he was afraid and fled, and went to Egypt.
Then Jehoiakim the king sent men to Egypt: Elnathan the son of Achbor, and  men  with him to Egypt.
And they brought Urijah from Egypt and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
